title: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs a try. One serving contains 543 calories, 17g of protein, and 16g of fat. For $1.57 per serving, this recipe covers 22% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 2. A mixture of butter, white wine, pasta, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. 209 people have tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by fullbellysisters.blogspot.com. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 83%, which is tremendous. If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs, Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs, and Pasta with Garlic, Scallions, Cauliflower & Breadcrumbs.

steps.step: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and white parts of scallions, cooking until fragrant. Add cauliflower florets and cook until tender.
Add white wine to the skillet and cook until reduced by half.
Toss cooked linguine pasta with the cauliflower mixture, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a sauce.
Stir in breadcrumbs and grated pecorino romano cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

extendedIngredients.name: cauliflower florets
extendedIngredients.original: about 2 cups frozen cauliflower florets, thawed, cut into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: couple of pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.original: couple of pinches red pepper flakes, optional
extendedIngredients.originalName: couple of red pepper flakes, optional

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 3 scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated

extendedIngredients.name: bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)
extendedIngredients.originalName: whole wheat bread crumbs (I used panko)

title: Vegan Buddha Bowl
summary: Enjoy a healthy and delicious Vegan Buddha Bowl, packed with a variety of colorful vegetables, quinoa, and a creamy tahini dressing. This recipe is not only vegan but also gluten-free, making it a perfect choice for those with dietary restrictions. With 350 calories per serving, it provides a nutritious and satisfying meal that's ready in just 25 minutes. Join 295 other food lovers who have already tried and liked this recipe!

steps.step: Cook the quinoa according to the package instructions. Once cooked, set aside.
While the quinoa is cooking, prepare the vegetables. Dice the cucumber, bell pepper, and red onion. Grate the carrot and slice the avocado.
In a small bowl, whisk together the tahini, lemon juice, water, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
To assemble the bowl, start with a base of quinoa, then arrange the vegetables on top. Drizzle with the tahini dressing.
Garnish with sesame seeds and fresh cilantro, if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy!

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: Try your hand at making Spaghetti Carbonara, a classic Italian pasta dish loved by many. This recipe features al dente spaghetti tossed with crispy bacon, creamy egg sauce, and grated Parmesan cheese. It's a comforting and satisfying meal that's ready in just 25 minutes. With 432 likes from fellow food enthusiasts, you know it's a winner!

steps.step: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining.
In a skillet, cook chopped bacon until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese. Add cooked spaghetti to the skillet with bacon and garlic, toss to combine.
Pour egg mixture over hot spaghetti and toss quickly until creamy. Add reserved pasta water a little at a time if needed to achieve desired consistency.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry Noodles
summary: For a quick and healthy meal, whip up some Vegetable Stir-Fry Noodles. This recipe features colorful vegetables stir-fried with tender noodles in a flavorful sauce. It's a vegetarian and gluten-free dish that's ready in just 20 minutes, making it perfect for busy weeknights. With 256 likes, it's a crowd favorite!

steps.step: Prepare the ingredients by chopping the vegetables and cooking the noodles according to package instructions.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add oil and sauté the garlic and ginger until fragrant.
Add the vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry until they are tender-crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked noodles and sauce to the skillet. Toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
Remove from heat and garnish with chopped green onions or sesame seeds if desired. Serve hot.

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.original: 2 stalks green onions, chopped (optional, for garnish)

extendedIngredients.name: mixed vegetables
extendedIngredients.original: 3 cups mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
extendedIngredients.originalName: mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
meta: such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots

title: Beef Tacos with Spicy Salsa
summary: Beef Tacos with Spicy Salsa is a flavorful Mexican dish that will spice up your dinner table. This recipe features seasoned ground beef topped with a spicy homemade salsa, all wrapped in warm tortillas. Each serving provides 520 calories, 25g of protein, and 22g of fat. Ready in just 35 minutes, it's a great option for a quick and delicious meal. With 310 likes, it's a favorite among taco lovers!

steps.step: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the ground beef until browned and cooked through. Drain excess fat.
Meanwhile, prepare the salsa by combining diced tomatoes, onion, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave.
Assemble the tacos by filling each tortilla with the cooked ground beef and topping with the prepared salsa.
Serve hot, garnished with additional cilantro and lime wedges if desired.

title: Creamy Lemon Chicken Pasta
summary: Indulge in the deliciousness of Creamy Lemon Chicken Pasta. This recipe features tender chicken breast cooked in a creamy lemon sauce served over perfectly cooked pasta. With 412 calories and 22g of protein per serving, it's a hearty meal that's sure to satisfy. Plus, it's ready in just 30 minutes! Enjoy the tangy flavor of lemon paired with the richness of cream in this delightful dish. It's a crowd-pleaser with 345 likes from other home cooks like you.

steps.step: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts to the skillet and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side depending on thickness. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, reduce heat to medium. Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add chicken broth, heavy cream, lemon zest, and lemon juice to the skillet. Bring to a simmer and cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Slice cooked chicken breasts into strips. Add chicken back to the skillet and stir to coat in the creamy lemon sauce.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine, allowing pasta to heat through in the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan cheese if desired.

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: Parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, for garnish

title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
summary: Enjoy a refreshing Mediterranean Chickpea Salad, packed with fresh vegetables, herbs, and a tangy lemon dressing. This salad is not only delicious but also vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free, making it a versatile and healthy choice. Each serving provides 220 calories and 8g of protein, perfect for a light lunch or side dish. With 180 likes, it's a popular recipe among health-conscious food lovers.

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, diced cucumber, cherry tomatoes (halved), red onion (thinly sliced), and chopped fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients in the large bowl and toss gently until everything is well coated.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

extendedIngredients.name: chickpeas
extendedIngredients.original: 1 can chickpeas (15 oz), drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

title: Caprese Salad with Balsamic Glaze
summary: Indulge in the flavors of Italy with a refreshing Caprese Salad drizzled with balsamic glaze. This classic salad features fresh tomatoes, creamy mozzarella, aromatic basil leaves, and a tangy-sweet balsamic reduction. It's a vegetarian and gluten-free dish that's ready in just 10 minutes, making it a perfect appetizer or side dish. With 240 likes, it's loved by many for its simplicity and delicious taste.

steps.step: Slice the fresh tomatoes and mozzarella into rounds.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices alternately on a serving plate.
Tuck fresh basil leaves in between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze over the salad.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as an appetizer or side dish.

extendedIngredients.name: cherry tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup cherry tomatoes, sliced into rounds

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mozzarella cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 8 oz fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced into rounds
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced into rounds

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

title: Lemon Garlic Butter Shrimp
summary: Treat yourself to succulent Lemon Garlic Butter Shrimp, a quick and flavorful seafood dish that's perfect for dinner. This recipe features tender shrimp cooked in a tangy lemon garlic butter sauce, served over rice or pasta. It's gluten-free and ready in just 20 minutes, making it ideal for busy weeknights. With 380 likes, it's a favorite among seafood enthusiasts!

steps.step: In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through.
Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, and chopped parsley.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately over cooked rice or pasta.

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

title: Greek Gyros with Tzatziki Sauce
summary: Enjoy the taste of Greece with flavorful Greek Gyros topped with creamy tzatziki sauce. This recipe features tender slices of seasoned meat (typically lamb or chicken) wrapped in warm pita bread with fresh vegetables and a tangy yogurt-based tzatziki sauce. It's a satisfying meal that's ready in just 30 minutes. With 315 likes, it's a beloved dish among Mediterranean food enthusiasts.

steps.step: Prepare the tzatziki sauce: Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture. In a bowl, combine grated cucumber, Greek yogurt, minced garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, chopped dill, salt, and pepper. Mix well and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Prepare the gyro meat: Season the meat (lamb or chicken) with salt, pepper, garlic powder, oregano, and olive oil. Let it marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Cook the meat: Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the meat for 3-4 minutes per side or until fully cooked and nicely charred. Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing thinly.
Warm the pita bread: Heat the pita bread in a toaster oven, oven, or microwave until warm and soft.

Assemble the gyros: Spread a generous amount of tzatziki sauce on each warmed pita bread. Add slices of cooked meat, sliced tomatoes, onions, and lettuce. Roll up the pita bread tightly and secure with foil or parchment paper.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

extendedIngredients.name: cucumber
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 cucumber, grated and squeezed to remove excess moisture
extendedIngredients.originalName: cucumber, grated and squeezed to remove excess moisture

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 tsp black pepper, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: meat (lamb or chicken)
extendedIngredients.original: 1 lb meat (lamb or chicken), thinly sliced

title: Ratatouille
summary: Delight in the flavors of France with Ratatouille, a classic vegetable dish that's as colorful as it is delicious. This recipe features a medley of eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes cooked in a savory herb-infused sauce. It's vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free, making it a versatile and healthy choice for any meal. With 280 likes, it's a popular dish that showcases the beauty of French cuisine.

steps.step: Prepare the vegetables: Wash and dice the eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes into roughly uniform pieces.
Sauté the vegetables: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add vegetables: Add diced eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes to the skillet. Season with salt, pepper, and dried herbs (such as thyme, oregano, and basil). Stir well to combine.
Simmer: Cover the skillet and let the vegetables simmer over medium-low heat for 30-35 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and flavors are well combined.
Adjust seasoning: Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
Serve: Serve hot or warm as a side dish or main course. Optionally, garnish with fresh herbs like parsley or basil.

extendedIngredients.name: black pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: dried herbs (such as thyme, oregano, basil)
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tsp dried herbs (such as thyme, oregano, basil)
extendedIngredients.originalName: dried herbs (such as thyme, oregano, basil)

title: Thai Green Curry
summary: Transport your taste buds to Thailand with aromatic Thai Green Curry, a flavorful dish featuring tender chicken or tofu cooked in a fragrant green curry sauce with coconut milk, bamboo shoots, and bell peppers. It's a gluten-free dish that's ready in just 40 minutes, perfect for a comforting dinner. With 340 likes, it's a favorite among fans of Thai cuisine.

steps.step: Prepare the protein: Cut chicken breast or tofu into bite-sized pieces.
Prepare vegetables: Slice bell peppers and drain bamboo shoots.
Cooking the curry: In a large pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add Thai green curry paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add protein: Add chicken/tofu to the pan and cook until lightly browned.
Simmer: Pour in coconut milk and stir in bamboo shoots. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until protein is fully cooked and flavors are well blended.
Season: Season with fish sauce and sugar to taste.
Serve: Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice or noodles. Garnish with fresh Thai basil leaves and sliced red chili, if desired.

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breast
extendedIngredients.original: 2 chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces

extendedIngredients.name: fish sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 1 tbsp fish sauce, or to taste

title: Mushroom Risotto
summary: Indulge in the creamy goodness of Mushroom Risotto, a classic Italian dish that's both comforting and flavorful. This recipe features Arborio rice cooked with earthy mushrooms, onions, garlic, and Parmesan cheese until creamy and tender. It's a vegetarian dish that's ready in just 35 minutes, making it a perfect option for a cozy dinner. With 290 likes, it's a beloved recipe for risotto enthusiasts.

steps.step: Prepare the mushrooms: Clean and slice the mushrooms.
Sauté aromatics: In a large pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onions and minced garlic, cook until softened.
Cook mushrooms: Add sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown.
Toast rice: Stir in Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Deglaze the pan: Pour in white wine and cook, stirring constantly, until the wine is absorbed.
Add broth: Gradually add warm vegetable broth, about 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
Finish the risotto: Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is creamy and tender, about 20-25 minutes in total.
Add Parmesan: Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and creamy.
Season and serve: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley and additional Parmesan if desired.

extendedIngredients.name: Black Pepper
extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 tsp black pepper, or to taste

extendedIngredients.name: Fresh Parsley
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tbsp fresh chopped parsley, for garnish

title: Teriyaki Salmon
summary: Savor the flavors of Japan with Teriyaki Salmon, a delicious dish featuring succulent salmon fillets marinated in a sweet and savory teriyaki glaze. This recipe is gluten-free and ready in just 30 minutes, making it perfect for a quick and healthy dinner. With 320 likes, it's a favorite among seafood lovers.

steps.step: Prepare the teriyaki marinade: In a bowl, mix together soy sauce, mirin, sake (or rice vinegar), brown sugar, minced garlic, and grated ginger.
Marinate the salmon: Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish or resealable plastic bag. Pour the teriyaki marinade over the salmon, ensuring it's coated evenly. Marinate for at least 15-20 minutes.
Preheat the oven: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Bake the salmon: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil. Place marinated salmon fillets on the baking sheet, skin-side down. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Baste with marinade (optional): If desired, baste the salmon with additional teriyaki marinade halfway through baking.
Serve: Remove salmon from the oven. Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds. Enjoy!

title: Pesto Pasta with Cherry Tomatoes
summary: Treat yourself to the vibrant flavors of Pesto Pasta with Cherry Tomatoes, a delicious Italian-inspired dish that's perfect for a quick meal. This recipe features al dente pasta tossed in fragrant basil pesto sauce with juicy cherry tomatoes and Parmesan cheese. It's a vegetarian dish that's ready in just 20 minutes, making it ideal for busy weeknights. With 280 likes, it's a beloved recipe for pasta enthusiasts.

steps.step: Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Prepare the pesto sauce: In a food processor, combine fresh basil leaves, pine nuts (or walnuts), garlic, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil. Blend until smooth and well combined.
Toss pasta with pesto: In a large skillet or mixing bowl, toss the cooked pasta with the prepared pesto sauce until evenly coated.
Add cherry tomatoes: Gently stir in halved cherry tomatoes into the pasta.
Serve: Divide the pesto pasta with cherry tomatoes into serving plates or bowls. Garnish with additional Parmesan cheese and basil leaves if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy!
